object.name: Administration
object.desc: This is a structure that contains sub-elements with administration information specific to the test taker and conditions surrounding the administration of the assessment required to properly interpret and score responses

element.name: StaffPersonalRefId
element.desc: GUID assigned to the educator or school staff that is associated with the result set.

element.name: Form
element.desc: Contains administration information specific to the assessment that is relevant to scoring, interpretation and reporting of results.

element.name: SpecialCondition
element.desc: Any special report information specific to the assessment being reported.

element.name: AdminTime
element.desc: Information about the time when the result was generated.

object.name: AdminTime
object.desc: Information about the time when the result was generated.

element.name: ResultDuration
element.desc: The time taken to complete the object being reported. The format of this value is DD:HH:MM:SS.SS where the seconds contain an optional decimal point with one or two additional digits.

element.name: StartDate
element.desc: Date activity/assessment is started.

element.name: FinishDate
element.desc: Date activity/assessment is finished.

element.name: StartTime
element.desc: Time activity/assessment is started.

element.name: FinishTime
element.desc: Time activity/assessment is finished.

element.name: DueDate
element.desc: Date activity, etc. is due. (To determine if the assessment was completed past the due date.)

object.name: Assessment
object.desc: This object is used to contain the exchange of test data structures. It can contain items or sections and may contain meta-data, objectives, rubric control switches, assessment-level processing, feedback and selection and sequencing information for sections. SIF_Events are reported.

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: The GUID for the assessment.

element.name: MaxAttemptsAllowed
element.desc: The number of attempts permitted.

element.name: LearningStandardItemRefId
element.desc: This is a reference to the LearningStandardItem that this assessment is referenced against

element.name: Title
element.desc: The title of the assessment.

element.name: AssessmentType
element.desc: Educational test or requirement code (test code). Indicates a particular national, regional, state, or local test or requirement. Values (based on GEM 2.0): AlternativeAssessment, AuthenticAssessment, Curriculum-basedAssessment, InformalAssessment, PeerEvaluation, Observation, PortfolioAssessment, SelfEvaluation, StandardizedTesting, Testing

element.name: AssessmentInstanceForm
element.desc: This describes the level of the assessment.ValuesAssessment, Level, Form, Subtest, ItemAs it is understood by the test publishing industry.

element.name: AssessmentComment
element.desc: This element contains the comments that are relevant to the assessment as a whole

element.name: Duration
element.desc: The amount of time that a participant is permitted to use in attempting to complete the assessment.

element.name: PauseFlag
element.desc: Indicates whether the assessment can be stopped or not.

element.name: Objective
element.desc: Used to store the information that describes the educational aims of the assessment. These objectives can be defined for each of the different 'view' perspectives. This element should not be used to contain information specific to an assessment because the question-engine may not make this information available to the item during the actual test.

element.name: AssessmentControl
element.desc: The control switches that are used to enable or disable the display of hints, solutions and feedback within the assessment

element.name: Rubric
element.desc: The rubric element is used to contain contextual information that is important to the element; e.g., it could contain standard data values that might or might not be useful for scoring the question. Different sets of rubric can be defined for each of the possible 'views'.

element.name: PresentationMaterial
element.desc: The information that is to be presented to set the context for the contained objects. This can be used to contain question-based material that is common to all of the child objects.

element.name: OutcomesProcessingExtension
element.desc: This is a container for any outcome processing instructions to be applied at the Assessment level. This container could either contain a URI to a proprietary local structure for selection ordering or utilize the Selection and Ordering Specification defined in IMS QTI ASI Specification 1.2c. [QTI]

element.name: AssessmentFeedback
element.desc: The assessment-level feedback that is to be presented as a result of assessment-level processing of the user's responses.

element.name: SelectionOrdering
element.desc: This element is used to contain the selection and ordering rules that are to be applied to the contained objects. This container could either contain a URI to a proprietary local structure for selection ordering or utilize the Selection and Ordering Specification defined in IMS QTI ASI Specification 1.2c. [QTI]

element.name: Reference
element.desc: This element is used to contain any common materials that are to be available to any of the child objects. The common material may or may not be presented to the participant. This could also be a URI.

element.name: AssessmentSectionRefId
element.desc: This is used to refer to one or more Sections that have been defined by an AssessmentSection object but which are to be logically related to this assessment.

element.name: AssessmentItemRefId
element.desc: This is used to refer to one or more AssessmentItems that have been defined by an AssessmentItem object but which are to be logically related to this assessment.

object.name: AssessmentComment
object.desc: This element contains the comments that are relevant to the assessment as a whole

object.name: AssessmentControl
object.desc: The control switches that are used to enable or disable the display of hints, solutions and feedback within the assessment

attribute.name: View
attribute.desc: The view defines the scope for the display of the associated information i.e. to whom the material can be presented. Values All, Administrator, AdminAuthority, Assessor, Author, Candidate, InvigilatorProctor, Psychometrician, Scorer, Tutor

attribute.name: SolutionSwitch
attribute.desc: The switch setting for the display of solutions within the assessment.Values Yes, No

attribute.name: HintSwitch
attribute.desc: The switch setting for the display of hints within the assessment Values Yes, No

attribute.name: FeedbackSwitch
attribute.desc: The switch setting for the display of feedback within the assessment. Values Yes, No

object.name: AssessmentFeedback
object.desc: The assessment-level feedback that is to be presented as a result of assessment-level processing of the user's responses.

attribute.name: AssessmentFeedbackRefId
attribute.desc: The GUID for the feedback.

attribute.name: View
attribute.desc: The view defines the scope for the display of the associated information i.e. to whom the material can be presented. Values All, Administrator, AdminAuthority, Assessor, Author, Candidate, InvigilatorProctor, Psychometrician, Scorer, Tutor

element.name: FeedbackTitle
element.desc: The title of the feedback section.

element.name: AssessmentFeedbackContent
element.desc: The assessment-level feedback that is to be presented as a result of assessment-level processing of the user's responses.

object.name: AssessmentItem
object.desc: An item is the most granular object of assessment. Often associated with a question and its associated attributes and processes. SIF_Events are reported.

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: The GUID for the AssessmentItem.

element.name: Title
element.desc: The title of the AssessmentItem.

element.name: LearningStandardItemRefId
element.desc: This is a reference to the LearningStandardItem that this assessment is referenced against.

element.name: Label
element.desc: A label that can be used by authoring tools to identify key features and classifiers.

element.name: MaxAttemptsAllowed
element.desc: The number of attempts permitted.

element.name: ItemComment
element.desc: This element contains the comments that are relevant to the item as a whole.

element.name: Duration
element.desc: The amount of time that a participant is permitted to use in attempting to complete the item.

element.name: Objective
element.desc: Used to store the information that describes the educational aims of the item. These objectives can be defined for each of the different 'view' perspectives. This element should not be used to contain information specific to an item because the question-engine may not make this information available to the item during the actual test.

element.name: ItemControl
element.desc: The control switches that are used to enable or disable the display of hints, solutions and feedback within the item

element.name: Rubric
element.desc: A scoring template that includes a range of qualitative or quantitative ratings, dimensions along which an artifact will be evaluated, and standards for each dimension at each rating level.

element.name: ResponseProcessing
element.desc: This is the element within which all of the instructions for the response processing are contained. This includes the scoring variables to contain the associated scores and the set of response condition tests that are to be applied to the received user response.

element.name: ItemContent
element.desc: This represents the type of question. This is an extension of the QTI profile [QTI].

object.name: AssessmentSection
object.desc: This object is used to define arbitrarily complex hierarchical section and item data structures. It may contain meta-data, objectives, rubric control switches, assessment-level processing, feedback and selection and sequencing information for sections and items. SIF_Events are reported.

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: This is the GUID for the AssessmentSection.

element.name: LearningStandardItemRefId
element.desc: This is a reference to the LearningStandardItem that this assessment is referenced against.

element.name: Title
element.desc: This is the title of the section.

element.name: MaxAttemptsAllowed
element.desc: The number of attempts permitted.

element.name: SectionComment
element.desc: This element contains the comments that are relevant to the section as a whole.

element.name: Duration
element.desc: The amount of time that a participant is permitted to use in attempting to complete the section.

element.name: PauseFlag
element.desc: Indicates whether section can be broken or not.

element.name: Objective
element.desc: Used to store the information that describes the educational aims of the section. These objectives can be defined for each of the different 'view' perspectives. This element should not be used to contain information specific to the items in a section because the question-engine may not make this information available to the items during the actual test.

element.name: SectionControl
element.desc: The control switches that are used to enable or disable the display of hints, solutions and feedback within the section

element.name: Rubric
element.desc: The rubric element is used to contain contextual information that is important to the element e.g. it could contain standard data values that might or might not be useful for scoring the question. Different sets of rubric can be defined for each of the possible 'views'.

element.name: PresentationMaterial
element.desc: The information that is to be presented to set the context for the contained objects. This can be used to contain question-based material that is common to all of the child objects.

element.name: OutcomesProcessingExtension
element.desc: This is a container for any outcome processing instructions to be applied at the section level. This container could either contain a URI to a proprietary local structure for selection ordering or use the Selection and Ordering Specification defined in IMS QTI ASI Specification 1.2c. [QTI]

element.name: SectionFeedback
element.desc: The section-level feedback that is to be presented as a result of section-level processing of the user's responses.

element.name: SelectionOrdering
element.desc: This element is used to contain the selection and ordering rules that are to be applied to the contained objects. Source: Selection and Ordering Specification defined in IMS QTI ASI Specification 1.2c. [QTI]

element.name: Reference
element.desc: This element is used to contain any common materials that are to be available to any of the child objects. The common material may or may not be presented to the participant.

element.name: AssessmentSectionRefId
element.desc: This is used to refer to one or more sections that have been defined by another AssessmentSection object but which are to be logically related to this AssessmentSection. This allows for nesting of subsections within sections.

element.name: AssessmentItemRefId
element.desc: This is used to refer to one or more items that have been defined by an AssessmentItem object but which are to be logically related to this AssessmentSection.

object.name: AssessmentSubTest
object.desc: A psychological construct measured by the assessment. Operationally, a subtest is a class of scores on an assessment. Some assessments may have only one subtest or type of score but most assessments measure more than one psychological construct. The subtest can be based upon items in a section or items that are empirically related. Subtests can also be composites of other subtests that are combined using a particular algorithm. Examples of subtests of an assessment are math total, reading composite, total test, English composition. SIF_Events are reported.

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: GUID assigned to AssessmentSubTest

element.name: AssessmentRefId
element.desc: GUID assigned to the assessment.

element.name: SubTestName
element.desc: Name of the subtest.ExamplesTotal Score, Total Math, Vocabulary, ReadingComprehension

element.name: CompositeIndicator
element.desc: Indicates whether this subtest is made up of a composite of other subtests.ValuesTrue,False

element.name: LearningStandardItemRefId
element.desc: This is a GUID reference to the LearningStandardItem that this subtest is referenced against

element.name: GradeLevels
element.desc: Refer to section 5.1.12 GradeLevels common element

attribute.name: DiagnosticRefId
attribute.desc: Identifier for the particular diagnostic

attribute.name: DiagnosticType
attribute.desc: Name of a SIF object or "NA" if RefIdType is not "SIF_GUID" Values LearningResouceResourceComponentActivityAssignmentAssessmentSubTestLessonAssessmentAssessmentItemSectionNA

attribute.name: RefIdType
attribute.desc: Values: SIF_GUID, URI, Namestring

element.name: DiagnosticStatement
element.desc: Contains the diagnostic statement

object.name: Form
object.desc: Contains administration information specific to the assessment that is relevant to scoring, interpretation and reporting of results.

element.name: Number
element.desc: A short descriptor of the form as used in standardized tests. (e.g. Form "6" or "C")

element.name: FormName
element.desc: Name or other identifier of the form

element.name: Level
element.desc: The level of the form that the student took or the current educational level of the test taker. Source: 1131 (Level of Individual or Test Code) [SPEEDE] Subset: 0K, 01, 02, 03, 04, 05, 06, 07, 08, 09, 10, 11, 12, PK, UN

element.name: Period
element.desc: Description of the time period in which the form is intended to be administered. ExamplesSpring, Fall, Pre-test, Post-test

object.name: ItemComment
object.desc: This element contains the comments that are relevant to the item as a whole.

element.name: ItemComment
element.desc: This element contains the comments that are relevant to the item as a whole.

object.name: ItemContent
object.desc: This represents the type of question. This is an extension of the QTI profile [QTI].

attribute.name: View
attribute.desc: The view defines the scope for the display of the associated information i.e. to whom the material can be presented.ValuesAll, Administrator, AdminAuthority, Assessor, Author, Candidate, InvigilatorProctor, Psychometrician, Scorer, Tutor

element.name: ItemContentType
element.desc: This is the item type. ValuesThis can include a URI pointing to your own type structure or you can pass the DTD or schema.

element.name: ItemAnswerList
element.desc: This is the item answer. ValuesThis can include a URI pointing to your own type structure or you can pass the DTD or schema.

object.name: ItemControl
object.desc: The control switches that are used to enable or disable the display of hints, solutions and feedback within the item

attribute.name: View
attribute.desc: The view defines the scope for the display of the associated information i.e. to whom the material can be presented.

attribute.name: SolutionSwitch
attribute.desc: The switch setting for the display of solutions within the item.

attribute.name: HintSwitch
attribute.desc: The switch setting for the display of hints within the item.

attribute.name: FeedbackSwitch
attribute.desc: The switch setting for the display of feedback within the item.

attribute.name: View
attribute.desc: The view defines the scope for the display of the associated information i.e. to whom the material can be presented. ValuesAll, Administrator, AdminAuthority, Assessor, Author, Candidate, InvigilatorProctor, Psychometrician, Scorer, Tutor

element.name: Title
element.desc: The title of the feedback section.

element.name: Feedback
element.desc: The feedback that is to be presented as a result of the user's responses. The feedback can include hints and solutions and both of these can be revealed in a variety of different ways.

element.name: LearningObjective
element.desc: Description of the educational objectives of the assignment.

object.name: Objective
object.desc: Used to store the information that describes the educational aims of the assessment. These objectives can be defined for each of the different 'view' perspectives. This element should not be used to contain information specific to an assessment because the question-engine may not make this information available to the item during the actual test.

attribute.name: View
attribute.desc: The view defines the scope for the display of the associated information i.e. to whom the material can be presented.

element.name: Objective
element.desc: Used to store the information that describes the educational aims of the item. These objectives can be defined for each of the different 'view' perspectives. This element should not be used to contain information specific to an item because the question-engine may not make this information available to the item during the actual test.

element.name: ObjectiveText
element.desc: Narrative description of learning objective(s) for the CurriculumStructure object.

attribute.name: RefIdType
attribute.desc: Values SIF_GUID, URI, Namestring. If the RefIdType is "SIF_GUID", it is assumed that OrganizationRefId refers to an LEAInfo object.

attribute.name: Type
attribute.desc: If RefIdType is "SIF_GUID", Type must be "LEAInfo" or "SchoolInfo", and the OrganizationRefId will contain a GUID reference to an object of that type.Values LEAInfo, SchoolInfo, NA

object.name: OutcomesProcessingExtension
object.desc: This is a container for any outcome processing instructions to be applied at the Assessment level. This container could either contain a URI to a proprietary local structure for selection ordering or utilize the Selection and Ordering Specification defined in IMS QTI ASI Specification 1.2c. [QTI]

attribute.name: ExtensionType
attribute.desc: A qualifier for the type of link contained in the OutcomeProcessingExtension element. ValuesURI, SIF_GUID If the ExtensionType value is "SIF_GUID". It is assumed that the RefId refers to a LearningResource object.

object.name: PresentationMaterial
object.desc: The information that is to be presented to set the context for the contained objects. This can be used to contain question-based material that is common to all of the child objects.

element.name: PresentationMaterialRefId
element.desc: Reference ID to a URI that references presentation material structures

object.name: PresentationMaterialRefId
object.desc: Reference ID to a URI that references presentation material structures

attribute.name: ReferenceType
attribute.desc: A qualifier for the type of link contained in the PresentationMaterialRefId element. Values URI, SIF_GUIDIf the ReferenceType value is "SIF_GUID". It is assumed that the RefId refers to a LearningResource object.

object.name: Rubric
object.desc: The rubric element is used to contain contextual information that is important to the element; e.g., it could contain standard data values that might or might not be useful for scoring the question. Different sets of rubric can be defined for each of the possible 'views'.

attribute.name: View
attribute.desc: The view defines the scope for the display of the associated information i.e. to whom the material can be presented. Values All, Administrator, AdminAuthority, Assessor, Author, Candidate, InvigilatorProctor, Psychometrician, Scorer, Tutor

element.name: RubricLinkList
element.desc: The RubricLink defines a URI to a reference document such as an instructor's guide for test scoring.

element.name: RatingList
element.desc: Quantitative or qualitative rating of performance level in an artifact, with regard to a particular criterion.

element.name: CriterionList
element.desc: Dimension along which an artifact is evaluated.

element.name: RubricStandardList
element.desc: Standard of excellence for each performance level on a particular criterion.

object.name: RubricLink
object.desc: The RubricLink defines a URI or a pointer to a reference document such as an instructor's guide for test scoring.

attribute.name: ReferenceType
attribute.desc: A qualifier for the type of link contained in the RubricLink element. ValuesURI, SIF_GUIDIf the ReferenceType value is "SIF_GUID". It is assumed that the RefId refers to a LearningResource object.

element.name: RubricLink
element.desc: The RubricLink defines a URI to a reference document such as an instructor's guide for test scoring.

element.name: Rubric
element.desc: A scoring template that includes a range of qualitative or quantitative ratings, dimensions along which an artifact will be evaluated, and standards for each dimension at each rating level.

element.name: RubricStandard
element.desc: Standard of excellence for each performance level on a particular criterion.

object.name: SectionComment
object.desc: This element contains the comments that are relevant to the section as a whole.

object.name: SectionControl
object.desc: The control switches that are used to enable or disable the display of hints, solutions and feedback within the section

attribute.name: View
attribute.desc: The view defines the scope for the display of the associated information i.e. to whom the material can be presented. ValuesAll, Administrator, AdminAuthority, Assessor, Author, Candidate, InvigilatorProctor, Psychometrician, Scorer, Tutor

attribute.name: SolutionSwitch
attribute.desc: The switch setting for the display of solutions within the section.

attribute.name: HintSwitch
attribute.desc: The switch setting for the display of hints within the section.

attribute.name: FeedbackSwitch
attribute.desc: The switch setting for the display of feedback within the section.

object.name: SectionFeedback
object.desc: The section-level feedback that is to be presented as a result of section-level processing of the user's responses.

attribute.name: SectionFeedbackRefId
attribute.desc: The GUID for the feedback.

attribute.name: View
attribute.desc: The view defines the scope for the display of the associated information i.e. to whom the material can be presented.ValuesAll, Administrator, AdminAuthority, Assessor, Author, Candidate, InvigilatorProctor, Psychometrician, Scorer, Tutor

element.name: FeedbackTitle
element.desc: The title of the feedback section.

element.name: SectionFeedbackContent
element.desc: The section-level feedback that is to be presented as a result of section-level processing of the user's responses.

element.name: SectionFeedback
element.desc: The section-level feedback that is to be presented as a result of section-level processing of the user's responses.

object.name: SelectionOrdering
object.desc: This element is used to contain the selection and ordering rules that are to be applied to the contained objects. This container could either contain a URI to a proprietary local structure for selection ordering or utilize the Selection and Ordering Specification defined in IMS QTI ASI Specification 1.2c. [QTI]

attribute.name: OrderingType
attribute.desc: A qualifier for the type of link contained in the SelectionOrdering element. ValuesURI, SIF_GUIDIf the OrderingType value is "SIF_GUID". It is assumed that the RefId refers to a LearningResource object.

object.name: SpecialCondition
object.desc: Any special report information specific to the assessment being reported.

element.name: ConditionCode
element.desc: A code or value indicating a special condition that occurred during the administration of the test or that exists with the test taker.

element.name: Description
element.desc: A textual description for a special condition that occurred during the administration of the test or that exists with the test taker.

element.name: SpecialCondition
element.desc: Any special report information specific to the assessment being reported.

object.name: StudentResultSet
object.desc: REMOVED in SIF 2.0. The student work produced by an assessment or activity in raw as well as scored form. This object can contain student responses to items, the score for a set of one or more items, or the scores for a set of one or more subtests. This object also contains context information related to the administration of the assessment or activity. SIF_Events are reported.

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: SIF GUID assigned to StudentResultSet.

element.name: StudentPersonalRefId
element.desc: GUID assigned to the student.

element.name: GradeLevels
element.desc: See 5.1.12 GradeLevels.

element.name: Description
element.desc: A short, plain text description of this result set.

element.name: Administration
element.desc: This is a structure that contains sub-elements with administration information specific to the test taker and conditions surrounding the administration of the assessment required to properly interpret and score responses

element.name: Result
element.desc: This is the structure that contains all the elements for the results that are being reported.

object.name: Result
object.desc: This is the structure that contains all the elements for the results that are being reported.

attribute.name: Type
attribute.desc: Describes the type of result contained in this element. ExamplesLearningResouceResourceComponentActivityAssignmentAssessmentSubTestLessonAssessmentAssessmentItemSection Objectives (Informal "non-learning standard item" types of objectives) Custom

element.name: AssessmentInstanceForm
element.desc: This describes the level of the assessment.Values: Assessment, Level, Form, Subtest, Item. As it is used by the test publishing industry in assessments.

element.name: Description
element.desc: Short, simple, textual description of ResultType (useful for custom results).

element.name: Score
element.desc: This is a structure containing scored results and scoring information specific to each score.

element.name: ResponseList
element.desc: Contains the actual response to a particular assessment item.

element.name: GradeBookFlag
element.desc: Optional flag for the grade book insertion process. This is used to give a gradebook application a hint as to whether it should log the information about this result in a grade book application. This is a designer feature. The author or compiler would indicate whether they intended this item as a grade book item or not.

element.name: LearningStandardItemRefIdList
element.desc: This is a GUID reference to the LearningStandardItem that this result is referenced against (This allows for the ResultType score to be used against a LearningStandard even if the original item/assessment was not matched. ie: a custom teacher quiz.)

object.name: Score
object.desc: This is a structure containing scored results and scoring information specific to each score.

attribute.name: ScoreRefId
attribute.desc: Reference to the specific subtest, task, item, etc. that is being reported. Refers to an object of the the type specified in the Result@Type attribute. The value of RefIdType can only be "SIF_GUID" if the Result@Type is pointing to a SIF object.

attribute.name: RefIdType
attribute.desc: Values: SIF_GUID, URI, Namestring

element.name: ScoreValue
element.desc: Contains the score for individual report items. ExamplesCorrectIncorrect ProficientPartially Proficient954Not Proficient

element.name: Min
element.desc: Minimum score possible.

element.name: Max
element.desc: Minimum score possible.

element.name: Cut
element.desc: Cutoff point for passing.

element.name: Score
element.desc: This is a structure containing scored results and scoring information specific to each score.

object.name: Response
object.desc: Contains the actual response to a particular assessment item.

attribute.name: ResponseRefId
attribute.desc: Reference to the specific subtest, task, item, etc. that is being reported. Refers to an object of the the type specified in the Result@Type attribute. The value of RefIdType can only be "SIF_GUID" if the Result@Type is pointing to a SIF object.

attribute.name: RefIdType
attribute.desc: Values SIF_GUID URI Namestring

attribute.name: ValueType
attribute.desc: Designates whether the value is the actual response or a reference to an external location. Values: Inline, URL

attribute.name: ContentType
attribute.desc: MIME-type of file

element.name: ResponseValue
element.desc: The response itself or a reference to the response as determined by the ValueType attribute.

element.name: Status
element.desc: Information about the response ExamplesCompletedPartially CompletedSeenNotViewed (the item or section was not actually viewed by the student)NotAnswered Attempted(The item or section viewed but no responses were given)Incomplete

element.name: Response
element.desc: Contains the actual response to a particular assessment item.

element.name: ItemAnswer
element.desc: This is the item answer. ValuesThis can include a URI pointing to your own type structure or you can pass the DTD or schema.

attribute.name: Width
attribute.desc: This identifies the width of the text box i.e. its x-axis length The reference size of the y-axis of the box is in pixels

attribute.name: Height
attribute.desc: This identifies the height of the text box i.e. its y-axis length. The reference size of the y-axis of the box is in pixels.

attribute.name: X0
attribute.desc: The top left hand X-coordinate point for the content

attribute.name: Y0
attribute.desc: The top left hand Y-coordinate point for the content

element.name: PresentationLabel
element.desc: A label that can be used by authoring tools to identify key features.

element.name: Instruction
element.desc: A element to contain instructions.

element.name: PresentationContent
element.desc: This element contains all of the instructions for the presentation of the question during an evaluation. This information includes the actual material to be presented. The labels for the possible responses are also identified and these are used by the response processing element defined elsewhere in the item.

object.name: ScoreValue
object.desc: Contains the score for individual report items. ExamplesCorrectIncorrect ProficientPartially Proficient954Not Proficient

attribute.name: Metric
attribute.desc: The metric or scale in which the actual test score result is reported. Values0056 Assessment Reporting Method [NCES Handbooks]

attribute.name: Weight
attribute.desc: Weight of the result. Defaults to "none"
